info.name: HR Management API
info.description:
StartFragment

HR Management API is a RESTful web service that provides functionality for managing employee data in an organization. The API supports CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) operations for employees, as well as authentication and authorization via JSON Web Tokens (JWTs). Other features include searching for employees by name, exporting all employee data to a CSV file, importing employee data from a CSV file, and retrieving logs of actions taken on employee data. The API is designed to be consumed by client applications that need to integrate employee management functionality into their workflow.

EndFragment

request.description:
StartFragment

The */register* endpoint allows users to create a new account. Users must provide their name, email, and password in the request body to register. After a successful registration, users can use their email and password to authenticate and obtain an access token via the Login endpoint.

EndFragme

StartFragment

The/logout endpoint allows authenticated users to revoke their access token and log out of the application. Users must include their access token in the request headers to be successfully logged out. After a successful logout, the access token is invalidated and cannot be used to authorize subsequent API requests.

EndFragmen

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

request.description:
StartFragment

The /login endpoint allows users to authenticate and obtain an access token for subsequent requests. Users must provide their email and password in the request body to be authenticated. The response includes an access token, which can be used to authorize subsequent API requests.

EndFragmen

header.warning: This is a duplicate header and will be overridden by the Content-Type header generated by Postman.

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint returns a list of all jobs in the system. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login or Register endpoint. The response includes an array of job objects, each containing a `name` field.

EndFragment

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to create a new job in the system. Users must provide a `name` field in the request body. The response includes the created job object.

EndFragme

StartFragment

This endpoint returns a specific job by ID. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login or Register endpoint. The response includes a job object with a `name` field.

EndFragment

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to update a specific job by ID. Users must provide a `name` field in the request body. The response includes the updated job object.

EndFragment

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to delete a specific job by ID. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login or Register endpoint. The response includes an error message incase not successfully deleted or no response message with code 204 when successfully deleted.

EndFragment

response.name: Failed

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint returns a list of all employees in the system. It requires authentication with an access token. The response includes an array of employee objects, each containing `id`, `name`, `email`, `age`, `salary`, `gender`, `hire_date`, `job_title`,`manager , created_at`, `updated_at`, fields.

EndFragment

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint returns a specific employee by ID. It requires authentication with an access token . The response includes an employee object with `name`, `age`, `salary`, `gender`, `hire_date`, `job_title` fields.

EndFragment

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to create a new employee in the system. Users must provide a `name`, `email`, `age`, `salary`, `gender`, `hire_date`, `job_id`, and `manager_id` fields in the request body. The `manager_id` field must correspond to the ID of an existing employee in the system (a self-join relationship). The response includes the created employee object.

EndFragme

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to update a specific employee by ID. Users must provide a `name`, `email`, `age`, `salary`, `gender`, `hire_date`, `job_id`, and `manager_id` fields in the request body. The `manager_id` field must correspond to the ID of an existing employee in the system (a self-join relationship) and cannot be the same as the employee's ID. If the employee being updated is a "founder" (i.e., has no manager), the `manager_id` field can be null, if not "founder" the `manager_id` field cannot be null. When the salary of an employee changes, the system automatically sends a notification email for the employee. The response includes the updated employee object.

EndFragment

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to delete a specific employee by ID. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login endpoint. An employee cannot be deleted if they are a manager of another employee. If the employee being deleted is a manager, all employees that report to them must first be reassigned to a new manager. The response includes a message indicating whether the employee was successfully deleted.

EndFragmen

response.name: Delete Employee Failed

item.name: Get all Managers of an Employee

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint returns a list of all managers of a specific employee, starting from the employee's direct manager and following the chain of command up to the top-level "founder" employee who has no manager. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login endpoint. The ID of the employee whose managers are being retrieved is passed as a parameter in the URL. The response includes an array of employee objects, each containing `name` fields. The employee objects are returned in order, with the employee's direct manager first and the founder last. If the employee being queried is the founder, the response will contain only one employee object (the founder) with a `manager_id` of null.

EndFragment

response.name: Get Managers For Specific Employee

item.name: Get Managers Salary of an Employee

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint returns a list of the names and salaries of all managers of a specific employee, starting from the employee's direct manager and following the chain of command up to the top-level "founder" employee who has no manager. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login endpoint. The ID of the employee whose managers' names and salaries are being retrieved is passed as a parameter in the URL. The response includes an array of objects, each containing `name` and `salary` fields for each manager. The objects are returned in order, with the employee's direct manager first and the founder last. If the employee being queried is the founder, the response will contain only one object (the founder) with a `name` field and a `salary` field.

EndFragment

response.name: Get Managers Salary For Specific Employee

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to search for employees by name. It requires authentication with an access token obtained via the Login endpoint. The search query is passed as a parameter in the URL, with the default parameter name set to 'q'. The search is case-insensitive and returns all employees whose name contains the search query as a substring. The response includes an array of employee objects. If no employees match the search query, an empty array is returned.

EndFragment

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to export all employee data to a CSV file. It requires authentication with an access token. When called, the server generates a CSV file containing all employee data, which is returned as a downloadable file.

EndFragment

StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to import employee data from a CSV file. The CSV file should be equal with the file contents in the 'file' field. The file must not contain a header row, and the data fields must be in the following order: `name`, `email`, `age`, `hire_date`, `salary`, `job_id`, and `manager_id`. The `manager_id` field can be left blank for only one employee if the employee is founder. If any data is missing or invalid, the server will return an error response indicating which data fields failed validation.

EndFragment

response.name: Import Employees Data

request.description:
StartFragment

This endpoint allows authenticated users to retrieve logs for a specific date. The date should be passed as a parameter in the URL in the format of `YYYY-MM-DD`. The response includes an array of log objects, each containing `user`, `action`, `employee`, and `details` fields. The `user` field indicates the user who performed the action, `action` describes the action taken, `employee` indicates the employee the action was taken on, and `details` provide additional information about the action taken. If no logs are found for the specified date, an empty array is returned.

EndFragment

response.name: Employee Logs of Specific Date
